text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we start to see evidence of early human civilisation, for example in cave paintings, but no one knows the connection between this and language. Although brains did not suddenly get bigger, humans became more complex and intelligent, which raises a question about whether using language caused their brains to develop, or if their more complex brains started to produce language.

best_attempt.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we start to see evidence of early human culture, for example in cave paintings, but no one knows what the connection is between this and language. Brains did not suddenly get bigger during this time, however humans did become more complex and intelligent. This creates a question for scientists: did using language cause their brains to develop, or did their more complex brains start to produce language?
